description: This function generates multiple unit square grids in the same picture for comparison, which can be used for teaching area comparison, perimeter comparison, and unit understanding. It supports up to 5 grids, each with different dimensions, and can create both regular and irregular grids.

educational_standards.description: Given multiple shapes, determine which shapes have the same area.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Multiple Grids for Comparison
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'generate_multiple_grids' function can draw multiple unit square grids in the same picture. It accepts a 'MultipleGrids' object as input, which contains a list of 'Grid' objects and an 'irregularity' setting. Each 'Grid' object specifies the length and width of the grid. The 'irregularity' setting determines whether the grids are regular, irregular, or a mix of both. The function can draw up to 5 grids, each with different dimensions. It is useful for teaching concepts related to area comparison, perimeter comparison, and unit understanding.

details: 'data': A 'MultipleGrids' object that contains a list of 'Grid' objects and an 'irregularity' setting.
'Grid': An object that specifies the length and width of a grid. Each 'Grid' object represents one grid to be drawn.
'irregularity': A setting that determines whether the grids are regular, irregular, or a mix of both.
At least one grid must be provided.
The function can draw up to 5 grids.
Each grid must have a length and a width.
The 'irregularity' setting must be one of the following: 'all_regular', 'all_irregular', 'mixed'.
The function draws multiple unit square grids in the same picture.
Each grid is drawn with its own dimensions.
The grids can be regular, irregular, or a mix of both, depending on the 'irregularity' setting.
